item.title: Can I use two-factor authentication (2FA)?
item.description:
Yes, LiveAgent, which is used for SmartWeb’s AI customer support, supports two-factor authentication (2FA) using Google Authenticator.

Benefits of Two-Factor Authentication link

By requiring a 6-digit one-time code in addition to your password during login, account security is significantly enhanced. Even if your password is compromised, unauthorized access can be prevented.

Available Authentication Methods link

  • Integration with authentication apps such as Google Authenticator
  • SSO integration with Google or Microsoft accounts (Single Sign-On), which can also indirectly apply two-step verification

This reduces security risks and allows you to conduct customer support operations with peace of mind.

item.title: Can login be restricted by IP address?
item.description:
Yes, SmartWeb’s AI-integrated ticket system allows you to restrict the login environment for support staff by IP address.

Available Restriction Methods link

  • Specific IP address specification: Set individual IP addresses to allow
  • Wildcard specification: Range specification like 192.168.1.*
  • Address range specification: Range from start IP to end IP
  • Subnet mask specification: Network-level restrictions

Use Cases link

  • When you want to allow access only from the office
  • When you want to allow only specific VPN connections during remote work
  • Access control based on security policies

This reduces the risk of unauthorized access and enables secure customer support operations.

item.title: AI Safety Measures
item.description:
SmartWeb’s Security Approach link

SmartWeb is built through the integration of FlowHunt and LiveAgent, providing comprehensive AI chatbots, knowledge bases, and ticket management. To handle customer data securely, we implement the following multi-layered security measures.

Data Protection Strategy link

Data Communication and Storage Security link

  • Communication encryption: All communications are encrypted with TLS (HTTPS) to protect data transmission paths.
  • Stored data encryption: Databases and backups are encrypted and stored in secure storage.
  • Prevention of external service leakage: Data is exchanged only between FlowHunt and LiveAgent, preventing data leakage risks to third-party services.
  • Access control: Permission-based access management ensures only authorized users can access data.

For more details, please see: ➡ FlowHunt Security Measures

item.title: Audit Log
item.description:
What is an Audit Log link

A function that records all operations performed within the system. It allows you to check who performed which operations and when, helping with security management and problem resolution.

Key Features of Audit Logs link

For example, all critical actions such as ticket deletion and configuration changes are recorded, enabling identification of responsibility when troubles occur. It is also important for strengthening compliance and internal controls.

item.title: Can two-factor authentication be used?
item.description:
Availability of Two-Factor Authentication link

Two-Step Verification with Google Authenticator link

SmartWeb fully supports 2FA (two-factor authentication) using Google Authenticator. This feature significantly enhances your account security. Two-factor authentication protects against unauthorized access by requiring a 6-digit temporary code generated from a smartphone app in addition to your regular password input.

Key benefits include:

  • Real-time security code generation
  • Easy integration with smartphone apps
  • Prevention of unauthorized logins

Authentication Using Single Sign-On (SSO) link

We also provide SSO integration (Single Sign-On) with Google and Microsoft accounts, which allows you to indirectly apply two-step verification. This approach leverages existing accounts to make the login process both simpler and more secure.

item.title: FlowHunt Security Measures
item.description:
FlowHunt Security Measures Overview link

Comprehensive Security Approach link

FlowHunt ensures security at all levels - infrastructure, data, organizational, and product - providing high reliability and security especially for small and medium-sized businesses.

Infrastructure Security link

Data Center Physical Security link

FlowHunt servers are hosted in facilities compliant with Tier IV or III+, PCI DSS, SSAE-16, or ISO 27001 standards.

  • Secure perimeters with multi-level security zones
  • 24/7 manned security and CCTV surveillance systems
  • Biometric authentication access control
  • Physical locks and security breach alarms

Network Security link

  • Redundant firewalls with best-in-class router technology
  • Secure communication through HTTPS encryption
  • 24/7 monitoring with intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDS/IPS)
  • Industry-leading defense systems against DDoS attacks

Data Protection and Encryption link

Data Encryption Strategy link

  • All FlowHunt databases and database backups containing sensitive customer data are encrypted
  • Column-level encryption protects sensitive fields such as API keys
  • Communication encryption through SSL/TLS protocols
  • Payment data encryption is handled by payment processor (Stripe)

Geographic Distribution of Data Centers link

FlowHunt services primarily host data in the European Union (Frankfurt data center), and customers can choose to have their service data located exclusively in the US or Europe.

item.title: GDPR Compliance
item.description:
What is GDPR link

GDPR is the EU’s data protection regulation and serves as an important legal framework for data management and privacy protection.

LiveAgent’s GDPR Compliance Features link

GDPR-Compliant Design link

LiveAgent emphasizes data protection, security, and compliance, with a design that meets GDPR requirements.

Key Compliance Features link

A suite of features that enables GDPR-compliant data management and privacy protection in accordance with EU data protection regulations. Enables transparent operations with regulatory compliance at no additional cost.

item.title: How is personal data handled?
item.description:
Personal Data Handling and Protection link

LiveAgent Data Management link

LiveAgent data is strictly managed in encrypted databases in compliance with GDPR. Your personal information is protected using the latest security technologies and safeguarded against unauthorized access and leaks. Data is always encrypted and subject to strict access controls.

GDPR Overview link

What is GDPR link

GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) is a regulation concerning the protection and handling of personal data within the EU (European Union). It came into effect on May 25, 2018, and applies to all organizations that handle personal data of individuals within the EU. GDPR has strengthened individuals’ rights over their own data and requires companies to implement stricter personal data protection measures.

item.title: IP Address Ban (Ban IPs)
item.description:
IP Address Ban Feature Overview link

Feature Description link

A feature that blocks specific visitor IP addresses from chat, contact forms, calls, suggestion boards, and forum posts to prevent fraudulent and nuisance activities. Malicious access is redirected as voicemail or spam, and ban history is stored in the admin panel.

Key Features and Benefits link

Access Blocking link

For example, by adding IPs that frequently engage in unauthorized access or spam posting to the ban list, all interactions are stopped, enabling safe and efficient response.

item.title: Multiple Data Centers
item.description:
Multiple Data Centers Overview link

Purpose of Data Center Deployment link

A feature that deploys multiple data centers worldwide (e.g., United States, Frankfurt, Singapore) and operates on the optimal server based on user location, achieving both stability and security.

Benefits of Region Selection link

User accounts are built in the optimal region during registration, enabling access speed optimization and compliance with regulations (e.g., data laws in the country of residence). This enhances scalability and availability that would be difficult to achieve with a single location, providing reliable services even for multi-regional business expansion.

item.title: Password Validator & Audit Log
item.description:
Password Validator & Audit Log Overview link

A feature that automatically validates password strength and ensures security by checking against past breach and leak information. Additionally, it records authentication-related operations as audit logs, which can be utilized for investigation during troubleshooting.

Main Features link

When users attempt to set weak passwords, errors or improvement suggestions are displayed, and warnings are also issued for passwords suspected of being compromised. Furthermore, logs record when and who performed password settings and changes, helping with cause identification and prevention of recurrence during unauthorized access incidents.

item.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
item.description:
What is Single Sign-On (SSO) link

Basic Concept of SSO link

An authentication feature that leverages authentication providers such as Google, Microsoft, Facebook, and Okta to enable access to multiple systems including LiveAgent with a single login. Achieves a high-level balance between security and convenience.

Benefits of SSO link

Simplified Login Process link

Implementing SSO eliminates the hassle of remembering and managing multiple passwords, streamlining the login process. Users can access multiple applications with a single secure authentication, which aligns with corporate security policies.

item.title: What about data encryption?
item.description:
Data Encryption Overview link

Data security is one of the most critical challenges in the digital age. At SmartWeb, we protect our customers’ data with the highest level of encryption technology, providing a secure usage environment. Data in transit and at rest is strictly protected according to the latest encryption standards, minimizing the risk of information leakage.

Communication Security link

TLS Encryption link

To protect data communication over the internet, we adopt TLS 1.2 and 1.3 protocols. This prevents eavesdropping and tampering during data transmission, ensuring secure communication. All API communications require HTTPS, and we thoroughly implement end-to-end encryption.

item.title: What are LiveAgent's Security Measures?
item.description:
LiveAgent Security: Comprehensive Customer Data Protection link

Security Features Overview link

LiveAgent’s helpdesk security is a multi-layered defense system that comprehensively protects customer data and corporate information in customer service.

Key Security Measures link

IP Address Restrictions link

  • Blocking specific IPs that make inappropriate inquiries or waste time
  • Ensuring customer service efficiency

Multi-Factor Authentication link

  • 6-digit code authentication via Google Authenticator
  • Additional security layer to prevent unauthorized login

Communication Encryption link

  • HTTPS encryption protects all communications between browsers and LiveAgent
  • Prevention of data interception and tampering

Infrastructure Security link

  • Geographic distribution and redundancy through multiple data centers
  • Server placement optimized for customer locations

Compliance Support link

  • Full compliance with GDPR (EU General Data Protection Regulation)
  • Proper processing and protection of personal data

Access Management link

  • Role-based access control
  • Appropriate permission settings based on department and position
  • Prevention of unauthorized access to confidential information

Effects of Security Measures link

Benefits for Companies link

  • Minimizing customer data breach risks
  • Ensuring compliance through regulatory adherence
  • Strengthening internal security

Benefits for Customers link

  • Safe protection of personal information
  • Environment where services can be used with confidence
  • Respect for privacy rights

Summary link

LiveAgent’s security features are a comprehensive solution that integrates technical protection measures with legal requirement compliance. Through multi-layered defense, it simultaneously achieves customer trust and business continuity, functioning as an “essential foundation” in today’s digital business environment.
